question: Who has become the fastest Indian to take 250 Test international wickets at home soil
explanation: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, on November 14, became the joint-fastest with Muttiah Muralitharan, to 250 Test wickets at home, getting there in 42 Tests. Ashwin achieved the feat when he cleaned up Mominul Haque for 37, shortly after lunch on day one of the first Test against Bangladesh in Indore. Ashwin became the joint-fastest to take 350 wickets, matching Muralitharanâ€™s feat in his 66th Test.
